title: How to Select Plants to Situate Near a Barbecue

steps.headline: Avoid plants that are at high risk of catching alight.
steps.description:
The following plants are at special risk of catching alight near open flames:
Australian natives - on the whole, these will contain too many volatile oils, for example, eucalyptus, wattles, bottlebrush, grevillea, etc. Plants with crisp leaves, such as cordylines
Any plants with brown leaf foliage build-up, including build-up on the ground area around the barbecue (sweep away!) Ornamental grasses, for example, pampas grass

steps.headline: Prefer plants that have a slower reaction to flames and are less likely to ignite.
steps.description:
Examples include:
Plants with waxy or glossy foliage (often subtropical varieties)
Agapanthus
Fruit salad plant/monstera deliciosa

steps.headline: Situate the barbecue well away from plant life as much as possible.
steps.description: Locating it over pavers, concrete, etc. next to stone, brick, etc. walls is preferable.

steps.headline: Avoid having any plant materials hanging near or over a barbecue, whatever species of plants you choose to have around the barbecue.
steps.description: Keep plants trimmed, remove dead plant matter regularly, and cut off any overhang that comes anywhere near the barbecue facility.

text:
Avoid plants that are at high risk of catching alight. The following plants are at special risk of catching alight near open flames:
Australian natives - on the whole, these will contain too many volatile oils, for example, eucalyptus, wattles, bottlebrush, grevillea, etc. Plants with crisp leaves, such as cordylines
Any plants with brown leaf foliage build-up, including build-up on the ground area around the barbecue (sweep away!) Ornamental grasses, for example, pampas grass Prefer plants that have a slower reaction to flames and are less likely to ignite. Examples include:
Plants with waxy or glossy foliage (often subtropical varieties)
Agapanthus
Fruit salad plant/monstera deliciosa Situate the barbecue well away from plant life as much as possible. Locating it over pavers, concrete, etc. next to stone, brick, etc. walls is preferable. Avoid having any plant materials hanging near or over a barbecue, whatever species of plants you choose to have around the barbecue. Keep plants trimmed, remove dead plant matter regularly, and cut off any overhang that comes anywhere near the barbecue facility.
